image.altText: Two men, one wearing a grey suit and a hat, the other a blue suit, flank a shorter blonde woman.

props.synopsis: Australia's last Liberal government has been on the brink of an early election for nine months. So how does Jeremy Rockliff keep surviving? The answer could be a fear of what comes next.

title.children: Tasmania's unhappy triumvirate hangs in there â€“ but is an early election in any of their interests?

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith dressed in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: It's been eight months since Ben Roberts-Smith's landmark defamation loss in his case against Nine Entertainment, but now a legal sequel of sorts is about to play out in a Sydney court.

title.children: Another chapter in Ben Roberts-Smith's long legal battle begins today

image.altText: Man in white shirt coughing or sneezing into elbow with white background

props.synopsis: Four years since COVID-19 spread around the world, medical researchers are still studying the effects on human health.

title.children: Have you been infected with COVID a few times? There might be something else going on

props.synopsis: Speaking with dozens of Coalition insiders during the making of the ABC docuseries Nemesis, one PM provoked the most polarised responses, writes Mark Willacy.

title.children: Senior Liberals asked to describe Abbott, Turnbull and Morrison in one word reveal intriguing theory

image.altText: A person shopping at Australian grocery store, with a basket full of sparkling water, fruits and vegetables.

props.synopsis: A report into soaring grocery prices, rising energy bills and steep airfares will be released on Wednesday. Its findings and recommendations will cause a headache for some of the country's biggest and most powerful companies, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: Australia is awash with oligopolies and the impact is on your bank account

image.altText: Modern houses along a street going up a hill in Brisbane

props.synopsis: A more stable interest rate environment, coupled with ongoing population growth and improved consumer confidence will support house price growth in 2024. Here's how your capital city fared in January.

title.children: See what the property market is doing in your capital city

image.altText: Side view of David O'Byrne at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Exiled former Tasmanian Labor leader David O'Byrne has finally quit the party, saying he wants to put a "difficult time" behind him and stand as an Independent at the next state election.

title.children: After 30 years, O'Byrne quits Labor to run his own race as an Independent

image.altText: A man speaking, while looking at the camera with one hadn raised in the air pointing a finger

props.synopsis: Taking on the Russian president can lead to being poisoned or imprisoned, but Boris Nadezhdin believes his anti-war stance is gaining traction among voters in one of the world's most authoritarian regimes.

title.children: The Russian politician risking all to take on Vladimir Putin

image.altText: A close up image of Joe Biden's face.

props.synopsis: If you apply fact, logic and history, the argument for a Joe Biden election victory over Donald Trump is overwhelming. ButÂ conventional wisdom isn't as reliable as it used to be, writes Leigh Sales.

title.children: Conventional wisdom would predict a Biden victory over Trump come November. But times have changed

image.altText: A traffic controlled holds hands above his head with light sticks in front of RAF jet.

props.synopsis: The United States intends to launch further strikes at Iran-backed groups in the Middle East, the White House national security adviser has warned, after hitting Tehran-aligned factions in Iraq, Syria and Yemen over the last two days.

title.children: White House warns of further strikes on Iran-backed groups

image.altText: A group of men carry a stretcher over a pile of rubble in the dark.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian officials have not responded to the claims.

title.children: Ukrainian shelling hits bakery in Lysychansk, killing 28, Moscow officials say

image.altText: Harry Dannock in karate uniform.

props.synopsis: Harry was 10 when clenching his fists during karate classes became difficult. But the real turning point came when he asked his mum and dad to stop hugging him because it hurt too much.

title.children: When Harry could no longer clench a fist during karate classes, it signalled the start of a long, painful journey

image.altText: Nick Ham before and after weight-loss surgery.

props.synopsis: Nick Ham lost about half his body weight after spending more than $20,000 on bariatric surgery -- much of it paid for by his dad, who withdrew from his superannuation on compassionate grounds.

title.children: Nick's lost 97kg through weight-loss surgery, but his dad had to dip into his super to pay for it

image.altText: An island with white sandy beaches, turquoise water, swaying palms and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's top diplomatic representative to Australia has declared that he's "quite confident" that Tuvalu won't follow Nauru's lead and switch diplomatic recognition to China, despite Beijing's attempts to "lure" politicians in the Pacific Island country.

title.children: Despite Beijing's attempts to 'lure' more support in the Pacific, Taipei backs Tuvalu to stick with Taiwan

image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: Households will now only have to grapple with a maximum of eight cash rate changes flowing through to their mortgages. Here's what that could mean for you.

title.children: What does fewer RBA meetings mean for my mortgage?

image.altText: Teenage girl sitting inside a car holding a steering wheel

props.synopsis: Young people say a "flaky" train system and limited bus timetable in Western Sydney leave them reliant on driving,Â as a state parliamentary inquiry considers the current and future needs of public transport in the booming region.Â

title.children: A car-dependent future has young people on Sydney's outskirts feeling stressed and isolated

image.altText: A man with a serious expression stands in front of a brick wall

props.synopsis: Sean Gibbons says he started experiencing fatigue, stomach upsets, pins and needles in his legs, and insomnia after helping decommission AGL's Torrens Island power plant. A blood test revealed he had lead levels three times higher than recommended.Â

title.children: Workers exposed to lead during decommissioning of power plant

image.altText: A woman with grey short hair sits next to a woman with short aurbun hair.

props.synopsis: Queensland police will investigate "around the clock" until they arrest the man responsible for the "abhorrent" killing of a grandmother at a shopping centre west of Brisbane.Â

title.children: Police seize car after stabbing death of grandmother at Queensland shopping centre

image.altText: A woman in a green blouse in front of a brick home.

props.synopsis: A Federal government program is offering people in certain parts of the country rebates to improve home security.

title.children: After catching a burglar on her property, Stephanie started looking for extra security

image.altText: Matt Comyn holds up a hand as he is surrounded by journalists on the street.

props.synopsis: Five years on from the banking royal commission, there's still plenty of work to do, and some serious unintended consequences to clean up.

title.children: It's five years since the final report of the banking royal commission, but many recommendations never happened

image.altText: Lowitja smiling

props.synopsis: WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander viewers are warned that this story includes images of an Indigenous person who has died.Â Dr Lowitja O'Donoghue, who fought endlessly for the rights of her people, has died aged 91.

title.children: Dr Lowitja O'Donoghue remembered as 'one of the most remarkable leaders this country has ever known'

image.altText: Will Sutherland high-fives Steve Smith in an ODI

props.synopsis: Australia wins its ODI series against the West Indies in two games as Sean Abbott stars with bat, ball and in the field in an 83-run victory at the SCG.

title.children: Australia seals ODI series victory against West Indies with 83-run win at SCG

image.altText: Burnt bushland next to a picture of the bushland covered in greenery

props.synopsis: A researcher who had cameras stationed throughout a central Queensland national park has captured the devastation of a months-long bushfire and the green shoots of returning life.

title.children: Life returns to scorched national park after bushfire burns almost 3,500 square kilometres

image.altText: A cow grazing on a sporting oval in an outback town.

props.synopsis: A small town council in Western Australia's Goldfields is considering building a fence around its town after a local council worker was knocked unconscious by a charging cow.

title.children: Wayward cattle invasion has outback council considering fencing town

image.altText: A close-up view shows a man's face in a white space suit as he lies on his back.

props.synopsis: Oleg Kononenko is expected to reach a total of 1,000 days in space on June 5, and by late September he will have clocked 1,110 days.

title.children: Russian cosmonaut sets new record for most total time in space â€” more than 878 days

image.altText: A dispersion of dust in hues of blue

props.synopsis: From colourful smidges to striking streaks and captivating swirls, the latest gallery of interstellar snapshots has it all.

title.children: NASA's Hubble telescope delivers spectacular images of galaxies

image.altText: Anthony Albanese during an interview on Insiders

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese vows he is an "honest person" as he continues to defend breaking an election commitment on the contentious stage 3 tax cuts.Â

title.children: Prime minister defends integrity as he explains tax cut change

image.altText: A beach and cliff

props.synopsis: Two men have died at a remote beach in Western Australia's Midwest region after a car was driven off a cliff in the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: Two men dead after car driven over cliff in Western Australia

image.altText: Shane Patton presser

props.synopsis: Victorian Police Chief Commissioner Shane Patton has labelled the actions of a group of protesters who confronted police at the annual Midsumma Pride march as "abhorrent".

title.children: Victorian police chief labels protesters who confronted police at Pride march 'an ugly rabble'

image.altText: A mum, dad, daughter, and baby daughter.

props.synopsis: The federal government says up to $20 million will be made available over seven years to find treatments for childhood brain cancers, including Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG).

title.children: Major research funding for childhood brain cancers gives families hope

image.altText: World map

props.synopsis: Statistics show a majority of Australians are prioritising travel despite the biting cost of living, even if that means tightening the belt in other areas. We ask experts what it would take for prices to fall and if there are ways to be a savvy traveller.

title.children: Why is overseas travel so expensive and how can I sneak in a low-cost getaway?

image.altText: A composite image of Leonard O'Meara and a drone shot of his house in Derby, WA.

props.synopsis: There are calls for an ASIC investigation after an Indigenous pensioner was charged an annual insurance premium of almost $10,000 by QBE for an asbestos-clad home in a remote town in Western Australia.

title.children: Calls for investigation after pensioner charged $54k for home insurance on 'asbestos cottage'

image.altText: A young woman in a three-piece suit and handcuffs is escorted by a man and a woman

props.synopsis: Fifty years ago, a teenaged heiress with a famous last name was kidnapped from her California apartment by armed terrorists. What followed was one of the most confounding crimes in American history.Â Â

title.children: This kidnapped heiress-turned-revolutionary was despised in America. Then a Hollywood star spoke out

image.altText: A sheep sticks its head through the bars of a window of the ship.

props.synopsis: The agriculture department says the number of deaths is below the reportable mortality rate, as authorities are continue deciding what will happen to the remaining stock.

title.children: 'Low number' of animals confirmed dead on live export ship MV Bahijah, off WA's coast

image.altText: Swimmers with blue floaties and blonde wigs in the ocean.

props.synopsis: What started out as a small community fundraiser with 50 participants has now turned into an event attracting hundreds of participants, and even international supporters. The annual Marilyn Monroe Jetty Swim this year broke fundraising and attendance records.

title.children: Blonde wigs and white bathing suits: Hundreds don Monroe look by the beach
